intro: Comparettia escobariana, commonly known as the Escobaria orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, sympodial growth habit. The plant features showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow with a distinctive lip. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and arranged in a rosette pattern. Comparettia escobariana thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
